event.title: grew outward from the mission and in 1852

data.event: The city grew outward from the mission and in 1852 became the original township of Los Angeles County.
Prior to the arrival of the Spanish to Alta California, the area that is now San Gabriel was inhabited by the Tongva Native Americans, whom the Spanish called the Gabriele침o.

event.title: Today a center for culture and art, the Mission San Gabriel Arc치ngel, founded

data.event: Today a center for culture and art, the Mission San Gabriel Arc치ngel, founded by Father Junipero Serra, is the fourth of twenty-one California Missions, and is known as the "Pride of the California Missions."

The Mission San Gabriel Arc치ngel served a pivotal role in the colonial Spanish society, with many of the area's first Mexican settlers being baptized at the mission, including future governor Pio Pico, who was born in 1801 at the mission and baptized there the same year.
